   u(x, t) = \int_{-\infty}^{\infty} \hat{u}(\xi, 0) e^{-t|\xi|^2} e^{i\xi x} d\xi
   \]
   This is exactly the solution obtained by directly evolving \( u(x, 0) \) under the heat equation.

Therefore, the application of the Fourier transform followed by evolution in Fourier space and then the inverse Fourier transform will yield the same result as direct evolution under the heat equation.
